abstract_ssm: The Hart family papers include correspondence, photographs, certificates, obituary notices, wedding invitations, genealogy notes and papers, deeds, insurance records, and securities account books. The papers also relate to the Linton and Packard families. Edith Linton married Frank Elsworth Hart in Plymouth Church in 1889 or 1890. He died in 1895, leaving her with two small boys.  His father, Frederick D. Hart, was chief engineer of Ridgewood Water Works. Edith then became a music teacher in the public schools and retired in 1921. Her son, Ronald Hart, attended Manual Training High School and was a member of the American Expeditionary Forces during World War I. In the 1920s he married Virigina Packard, a librarian, writer, and interior designer. She operated shops out of the Hotel Bossert and on the north shore of Long Island. The Virginia M. Packard Hart Scholarship was established at Pratt Institute in her memory.
corpname_ssm: Manual Training High School (Brooklyn, New York, N.Y.)
